data.question: What is the chemical formula for the Zn-tetrazole complex Zn-1?
Which Zn-tetrazole complex has the largest void around the N3−N4 bond according to the crystal structure analysis?
True or False: The photoreactivity of Zn-3 is due to the electronic effect of the carboxylic groups.
What is the yield of the nitrile imine product after photoirradiation of the Zn-3 crystal?
Which method was used to observe the structure of a nonstabilized nitrile imine photochemically generated in situ in the solid state?
True or False: The bent geometry of the nitrile imine can be ascribed to either the 1,3-dipolar or carbenic structure.
What was the major product in the water-quenching experiment of tetrazole 3?
True or False: The dissociated N2 was visible in the photodifference map with a bond length of 0.89(9) Å.
What was the occupancy of N2 in the crystal lattice after photoirradiation of Zn-3?
True or False: The efficiency of tetrazole ring rupture in the solid state does not depend on the size of the void around the N3−N4 bond.
What was the dihedral angle for the nitrile imine in the solid state compared to tetrazole 3?
data.answer: 62.1° for the nitrile imine vs 38.8° for 3

data.question: True or False: The bent geometry in the 1,3-dipolar structure can explain the high reactivity of the photogenerated nitrile imines in cycloaddition reactions in aqueous media.
Which Zn-tetrazole complex showed a discrete photodifference map after 2 min of photoirradiation at 90 K?
True or False: The selective formation of the 1,3-addition product when a reactive nitrile imine was photogenerated in water contradicts the bent nitrile imine geometry.
What was the experimental error of the bond length of dissociated N2 in the photodifference map compared to its value in molecular N2?
data.answer: Within experimental error of its value in molecular N2 (1.09 Å)

data.question: True or False: The photoreactivity of Zn-free crystal of 3, which has smaller voids around N3−N4 in the crystal, yielded a recognizable photodifference map.
What was the method used for the structural refinement of nitrile imines?
True or False: Theoretical calculations of nitrile imine structures have always been consistent in the literature.
What was the basis for the water-quenching experiment to distinguish between the 1,3-dipolar and carbenic structures?
data.answer: The expected reaction products from each structure

data.question: True or False: The bent geometry of the nitrile imine disagrees with the 1,3-dipolar structure.
